thread.title: Cold snap hits Hong Kong as temperatures plunge into single digits
thread.title_full: Cold snap hits Hong Kong as temperatures plunge into single digits

author: Naomi Ng
title: Cold snap hits Hong Kong as temperatures plunge into single digits
text:
Cold snap hits Hong Kong as temperatures plunge into single digits 
Intense winter monsoon brings chilly weather to southern China  29am  29am Don’t fret: Hong Kong to get wet-weather reprieve this week 16 Jan 2017 
A cold snap hit the city as temperatures plunged into the single digits overnight, with crisp weather to remain in the coming few days. 
Temperatures were as low as nine degrees Celsius in urban areas by 8am on Thursday morning, with the cold weather warning and strong monsoon signal still in force. 
“An intense winter monsoon will bring cold weather to southern China in the next couple of days,” the Hong Kong Observatory forecast. 
Temperatures are likely to remain between 12 and 17 degrees, and are set to dip slightly on Friday to between 11 and 16 degrees. 
“The temperature difference between day and night will be relatively large under fine and dry conditions,” the forecaster warned. 
The weather is expected to warm up gradually by Monday, reaching a maximum of 20 degrees. 
The Centre for Health Protection reminded members of the public, particularly the elderly and those with chronic illnesses, to bundle up and consume sufficient food.
